comment._content: I think you must know a good deal about naval history, nudecowboy, if you know enough of the implications of the 1922 Washington Naval treaty to put that and this gun together. That's a deduction I had not managed to make myself. Funnily enough, last night I was just reading about our own HMAS Australia (I), once the flagship of the Royal Australian Navy which was scuttled in 1924 in compliance with the treaty. She had 8 x 12-inch guns. www.navy.gov.au/HMAS_Australia_(I)
